revision.text:
[[file:Caelum volff.png|thumb|Caelum Volff in {{XC|-}}]] '''Volffs''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|ヴォルフ}}, ''Vorufu'') are a species of enemy in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are similar in appearance to a wolf.
Volffs undergo minor appearance changes between games; their manes are longer and colored differently in {{XC2}} and {{TTGC}}, but otherwise they are very similar to the original designs in {{XC}}.
== {{XC|-}} == Volffs can be found on [[Bionis' Leg]], in [[Satorl Marsh]], and on the [[Fallen Arm]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Caelum Volff]] * [[Leader Volff]] * [[Leg Volff]] * [[Officer Volff]] * [[Partner Volff]] * [[Satorl Volff]] * [[Ugly Volff (XC1)|Ugly Volff]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Ferocious Volff]] (during ''[[Save the Girl!]]'') * [[Hungry Volff]] (during ''[[What is Courage?!]]'')
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Aged Leraje]] * [[Napping Volfen]] * [[Swift Zektol]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == Volffs can be found on the [[Bionis' Shoulder]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Leg Volff]] * [[Officer Volff]] * [[Satorl Volff]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Revenant Volff]] (during ''[[Inclined to Climb]]'')
== {{XC2|-}} == Volffs can be found in [[Gormott Province]], the [[Kingdom of Uraya]] or the [[Kingdom of Tantal]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Brewl Volff]] * [[Giron Volff (XC2)|Giron Volff]] * [[Land Volff (XC2)|Land Volff]] * [[Red Volff]] * [[Rip Volff]] * [[Samoo Volff]] * [[Young Volff]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Donya Volff]] (During ''[[Flames of Justice]]'') * [[Mirrl Volff]] (During ''Flames of Justice'') * [[Noral Volff]] (During ''Flames of Justice'') * [[Snooz Volff]] (During ''[[Knocked About Nopon]]'') * [[Uhrl Volff]] (During ''Flames of Justice'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Blue-Eyed Korbin]] ([[Driver (enemy)|Driver]] with [[Blade (enemy)|Blade]])
=== Challenge Battle Mode Enemy === * [[Hunting Volff]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Firm Volff]] * [[Gemini Volff]] * [[Ralsh Volff]] * [[Sable Volff]]
=== Story Exclusive Enemy === * [[Raging Volff]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Innocent Volff]] (During ''[[Passing the Torch]]'') * [[Timid Volff]] (During ''[[A Simple Errand]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Lunar Amaruq]]
== {{XC3|-}} == In {{XC3}}, Volffs can be found in many places across [[Aionios]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Avee Volff]] * [[Aviga Volff]] * [[Curran Volff]] * [[Giron Volff (XC3)|Giron Volff]] * [[Jarack Volff]] * [[Land Volff (XC3)|Land Volff]] * [[Lesser Volff]] * [[Luina Volff]] * [[Robnos Volff]] * [[Rood Volff]] * [[Ugly Volff (XC3)|Ugly Volff]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[False Volff]] (During ''[[Transparent Dreams]]'') * [[Rhodhii Volff]] (During ''[[Shadow of Enmity]]'') * [[Rhodya Volff]] (During ''Shadow of Enmity'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Lapdog Veece]]
=== Quest Exclusive Bosses === * [[Debria Volff]] (During ''[[Yorde's Request]]'') * [[Hunter Volff]] (During ''[[No Want of Courage]]'')
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Jarack Volff]] * [[Land Volff (XC3)|Land Volff]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Advent Wolf Marduk]]
=== Boss === * [[Skarn Volff]]
=== Quest Exclusive Boss === * [[Encounter Volff]] (During ''[[Where Is That Guy?]]'')
== Trivia == * The Japanese name for ''Volff'', which is {{lang|ja|ヴォルフ}} (''Vorufu''), is actually the Japanese adaptation of the German word ''Wolf'' ({{IPA|/ˈvɔlf/}}), which simply means "wolf." The English word ''wolf'' ({{IPA|/ˈwʊlf/}}) is usually adapted to Japanese as {{lang|ja|ウルフ}} (''urufu'').
== Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === <gallery> Ferocious Volff.jpg Partner Volff.jpg </gallery>
=== {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> UhrlVolff.jpg|Uhrl Volff SnoozVolff.jpg|Snooz Volff XC2 Blue-Eyed Korbin.jpg|Blue-Eyed Korbin, a Driver Volff </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> Firm Volff.jpg|Firm Volff SableVolff.jpg|Sable Volff </gallery>
=== {{XC3|-}} === <gallery> Lesser Volff.png|Lesser Volff XC3 False Volff.png|False Volff XC3 Lapdog Veece.png|Lapdog Veece </gallery>
=== {{XC3FR|sub}} === <gallery> Advent Wolf Marduk.jpg|Advent Wolf Marduk Jarack Volff FR.jpg|Jarack Volff Land Volff FR.jpg|Land Volff Skarn Volff.jpg|Skarn Volff </gallery>

[[File:XC3 Bunez Vollgull.png|thumb|Bunez Vollgull]] '''Vollgulls''' are a family of flying enemies in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Bunez Vollgull]] * [[Rafale Vollgull]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Invaiss Vollgull]] (During ''[[So Much More to See]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Perilwing Ryuho]] ([[Superboss]])
=== Quest Exclusive Boss === * [[Nopon Eater]] (DLC, during ''[[The Hope of Noponkind]]'')
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Dark Vollgull]] ([[Fogbeast]]) * [[Young Vollgull]] * [[Grippen Vollgull]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Fograptor D'nari]] (Fogbeast) * [[Surrogate Fitzpatrick]]
== Trivia == * Despite having the name of Young Vollgull, they actually have the same model and moveset of [[Rhogul]]s.
== Gallery == <gallery> XC3 Perilwing Ryuho (cropped).png|Perilwing Ryuho Invaiss Vollgull.jpg|Invaiss Vollgull XC3 Nopon Eater.png‎|Nopon Eater Dark Vollgull.jpg|Dark Vollgull </gallery>
{{clr}}
{{xc3 stub}}

[[File:XC3 Wicked Wolf Aranqui.png|thumb|Wicked Wolf Aranqui]] '''Vvargas''' are a family of enemies in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. They share many similarities with [[Volff]]s.
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Jarack Vvarga]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Wicked Wolf Aranqui]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Quest Exclusive Bosses === * [[Rogal Vvarga]] (During ''[[Big Game: Rogal Vvarga]]'') * [[Rox Vvarga]] (During ''Big Game: Rox Vvarga'')
== Gallery == <gallery> Rox Vvarga.jpg|Rox Vvarga </gallery> {{clr}}
{{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Species]] [[Category:XC3 Vvargas]] [[Category:XC3 Terrestrial Life]] [[Category:XC3FR Species]] [[Category:XC3FR Vvargas]] [[Category:XC3FR Terrestrial Life]] [[Category:Vvargas]] [[Category:Species by Type]]

{{for|the enemy from {{XC2|-}}|Wacon Upa (XC2)}} {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Wacon Upa |image = XC3 Wacon Upa.jpg |caption = Wacon Upa |movement = Ground |type = [[Upa]]
|tab1 = Rae-Bel Tableland |category = Normal Minor Enemy |level = 22-23 |area = [[Rae-Bel Tableland]] ([[Dumas' Jaw]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp =
|tab2 = Challenge Battle |category2 = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Enemy]] |level2 = 72 |area2 = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |spawntime2 = During ''[[Arts and Crafts]]'' |respawn2 = No |detection2 = |exp2 = |cp2 = |sp2 = }} '''Wacon Upas''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3}}. They are members of the [[Upa]] family, and can be found at level 22-23 at [[Dumas' Jaw]] on the [[Rae-Bel Tableland]]. Two are also fought at level 72 during the fifth wave of the [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge Battle]] ''[[Arts and Crafts]]''.
== Drops == * [[Magnificent Upa Lure]] * [[Gooey Upa Egg]]
{{clr}}
{{xc3 stub}}
[[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Fornis Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Upas]] [[Category:XC3 Level 21-25 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 71-75 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]]

{{spoiler}} {{quote|An invaluable Healer who ensures the party's continued survival with healing and buffs.|Class menu description}} [[File:XC3 War Medic Weapon Icon.png|thumb|War Medic Class Icon]] '''War Medic''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|ウォーメディック}}, ''Uōmedikku'') is a [[Keves]]i [[Healer]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] in {{XC3}}.[https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1534069323538792449]. == Overview == War Medics specialize in combat support, such as recovery and strengthening the abilities of their companions. They have a [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Talent Art]] that can [[Hit Points (XC3)|heal]] all of their allies. War Medic is the class of [[Valdi]]. It is unlocked by completing the [[Hero Quest]] ''[[The Kind Right Hand]]''. The [[Class Rank (XC3)|Class Rank]] limit can be increased to 20 by completing the Ascension Quest ''[[I'm a Mechanic]]''. {{clr}} == Class Aptitude and Unlock Requirements == {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Party Member |[[File:Icon chara battle n0ah.png|60px]]
'''[[Noah]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 1.png|60px]]
'''[[Mio]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 2.png|60px]]
'''[[Eunie]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 3.png|60px]]
'''[[Taion]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 4.png|60px]]
'''[[Lanz]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 5.png|60px]]
'''[[Sena]]''' |- !Aptitude |[[File:XC3 Aptitude C Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude A Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude S Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]] |- !Class Unlock Points Required |5,025 |2,515 |4,190 |3,350 |''Class Inheritor'' |5,865 |} == Class Rank Requirements == {| class="xc1 centered" width="45%" ! Rank ! CP needed ! Nopon Coin Cost |- | 1 | colspan="2" | None |- | 2 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 3 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 4 | 285 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 5 | 285 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 6 | 345 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 7 | 345 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 8 | 375 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 9 | 375 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 10 | 400 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | colspan="3" class="event" | Complete ''[[I'm a Mechanic]]'' |- | 11 | 370 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 12 | 370 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 13 | 490 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 14 | 490 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 15 | 610 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 16 | 610 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 17 | 730 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 18 | 730 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 19 | 790 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 20 | 915 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |} {{clr}} == Class Stats == The War Medic class grants the following multipliers to a character's base stats (see their individual pages for their base stats), and sets their Physical and Ether Defense to the following values, depending on their current Rank. Intermediate values are linearly interpolated between the minimum and maximum values, rounding to the nearest percent. {| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 55% || 50% || 120% || 110% || 70% || 5% || 20% |- | 10 || 57% || 52% || 122% || 115% || 72% || 10% || 22% |- | 20 || 60% || 55% || 125% || 120% || 75% || 15% || 25% |} === Weapon Stats === The character's Attack stat after being modified by the above class stats is further modified by adding the class's weapon stat, which depends on the character's [[Level (XC3)|Level]], to obtain the final base Attack stat. These weapon stats also determine the character's Critical Rate and Block Rate. Characters temporarily assume these weapon stats to calculate relevant statistics when using a Master Art from this Class without it being part of a Fusion Art. If a Master Art is used in a Fusion Art, the weapon stats corresponding to the character's current Class will be used instead for calculations. {| class="xc1 centered" width="60%" ! Level !! Attack !! Critical Rate !! Block Rate |- | 1 || 15 || 3% || 4% |- | 10 || 32 || 3% || 4% |- | 20 || 57 || 4% || 5% |- | 30 || 89 || 4% || 5% |- | 40 || 124 || 4% || 6% |- | 50 || 165 || 5% || 6% |- | 60 || 210 || 5% || 6% |- | 70 || 261 || 5% || 7% |- | 80 || 318 || 5% || 7% |- | 90 || 382 || 6% || 8% |- | 99 || 448 || 6% || 8% |} == Arts == * '''[[Technical Heal]]''' ([[Battle Arts (XC3)|Talent Art]]) - Heal party * [[Multi Blast]] - Area heal on hit (Rank 1 Master Art) * [[Heal Bullet (XC3)|Heal Bullet]] - AOE / Heal * [[Advanced Cooldown]] - Field / Def. up (Rank 10 Master Art) * [[Cure Bullet (XC3)|Cure Bullet]] - AOE/Clear debuffs/Debf. barrier * [[Vital Bullet]] - AOE / Delayed healing === Hero-Exclusive Arts === * '''[[Trickshot (XC3)|Trickshot]]''', Area heal on hit * '''[[Hyper Reload]]''', Field / Def. up * '''[[Surprise Beat]]''', Atk down / Machines↑ == Class Skills == * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 1.png]] '''Recovery Engine''': Removing debuffs boosts own Healing Power by 30-50% (up to a maximum of 150%). * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 16.png]] '''Healing License''': Boosts amount of HP healed from using healing Arts by 20-30%. (Rank 5 Master Skill) * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 25.png]] '''Rescue License''': Increases HP restored when reviving an ally by 20-40%. * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 23.png]] '''Antibody System''': Shortens duration of debuffs on self by 30-50%. (Rank 15 Master Skill) === Stat Increases === {| class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%;" !Class Rank !Antibody System !Healing License !Recovery Engine !Rescue License |- | 1 | 30% | 20% | 30% | 20% |- | 5 | 35% | 22% | 35% | 25% |- | 10 | 40% | 25% | 40% | 30% |- | 15 | 45% | 27% | 45% | 35% |- | 20 | 50% | 30% | 50% | 40% |} == Class Rank Requirements == {| class="xc1 centered" width="45%" ! Rank ! CP needed ! Nopon Coin Cost |- | 1 | colspan="2" | None |- | 2 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 3 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 4 | 285 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 5 | 285 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 2 |- | 6 | 345 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 7 | 345 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 8 | 375 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 9 | 375 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 10 | 400 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | colspan="3" class="event" | Complete ''[[I'm a Mechanic]]'' |- | 11 | 370 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 12 | 370 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 13 | 490 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 14 | 490 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 15 | 610 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 16 | 610 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 17 | 730 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 18 | 730 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 19 | 790 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 20 | 915 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |} {{clr}} == Gallery == XC3 Valdi Artwork.png|Valdi, a War Medic War Medic Noah.png|Noah as a War Medic War Medic Mio.png|Mio as a War Medic War Medic Eunie.png|Eunie as a War Medic War Medic Taion.png|Taion as a War Medic War Medic Lanz.png|Lanz as a War Medic War Medic Sena.png|Sena as a War Medic == References == {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Classes]]
